parameters.name: runnerNodeId
parameters.description: The ID which identifies the runner that will execute the returned run.

parameters.name: selector
parameters.description: A selector which type of run you want to receive. Currently only `TERRAFORM` or `MANUAL` is possibly. If you don't specify any, you will get a run of any type. (Optional)

parameters.name: workspaceIdentifier

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter for Building Blocks with the given display name. (optional)

parameters.name: definitionName
parameters.description: Filter for Building Blocks that belong to the definition with the given name. (optional)

parameters.name: versionNumber
parameters.description: Filter for Building Blocks that use a certain version number. Can be the number or only 'v1', etc. (optional)

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter for Building Blocks that have a certain status. One of WAITING_FOR_DEPENDENT_INPUT, WAITING_FOR_OPERATOR_INPUT, PENDING, IN_PROGRESS, SUCCEEDED, FAILED. (optional)

parameters.description: Filter for meshTenants with a certain deletion state. _links.description: Contains the self link, a link to the related tenant and <<paging,pagination>> links.

_embedded.description: Contains the actual content of the paged response.

name.description: The identifier that should be unique within a workspace

ownedByWorkspace.description: The identifier of the workspace that the project should belong to.

metadata.description: Fixed fields that help to identify the meshProject.

apiVersion.description: Version of meshProject datatype. Matches the version part provided within the `Accept` request header.

kind.description: As a common meshObject structure exists, every meshObject has a 'kind'. This is always 'meshProject' for this endpoint.

substitutePaymentMethodIdentifier.description: The substitute payment method of the project.

paymentMethodIdentifier.description: The payment method of the project.

displayName.description: The display name of the project as it is shown in meshPanel.

tags.description: Key/Value pairs of tags set on the project. Keep in mind, that values are an array. Also see our general section about <<tags>>

spec.description: All fields in this section describe the project.

ownedByProject.description: The identifier of the meshProject the meshTenant belongs to.

assignedTags.description: The tags assigned to this meshTenant originating from meshWorkspace, Payment Method and meshProject. Keep in mind, that values are an array. Also see our general section about <<tags>>

deletedOn.description: If the meshTenant has been submitted for deletion by a Workspace Manager, the <<data_types,date>>, the date is represented here (e.g. `2020-12-22T09:37:43Z)`. Otherwise this field is missing.

platformIdentifier.description: The identifier of the related platform instance

tenantIdentifier.description: The full identifier of this tenant is a unique string consisting of the workspace identifier, project identifier and platform identifier separated by '.'.

ownedByWorkspace.description: The identifier of the meshWorkspace the meshTenant belongs to.

metadata.description: Always contains the 'ownedByProject', 'ownedByWorkspace' and 'platformIdentifier' to identify the meshTenant.

apiVersion.description: Version of meshTenant datatype. Matches the version provided in the `Accept` request header.

_links.description: Currently only contains the self link.

kind.description: As a common meshObject structure exists, every meshObject has a 'kind'. This is always 'meshTenant' for this endpoint.

quotas.description: The set of applied Tenant Quotas. They can be set individually per tenant. By default the Landing Zone quotas are applied to new meshTenants.

landingZoneIdentifier.description: The identifier of the Landing Zone of this meshTenant. This field will be empty if the meshTenant has no Landing Zone.

localId.description: The localId (platform tenant id) assigned with this meshTenant. It will only be set if the tenant  was either imported via meshObject API with a localId or if at least one replication run finished successfully for this tenant.

spec.description: All fields in this section describe the meshTenant.

name.description: The workspaceUserGroupIdentifier as 'name' to uniquely identify the meshWorkspaceUserGroup.

ownedByWorkspace.description: The identifier of the workspace that owns this WorkspaceUserGroup.

metadata.description: Always contains the 'name' to uniquely identify the meshWorkspaceUserGroup. It also contains the workspace name that owns this WorkspaceUserGroup.

apiVersion.description: Version of meshWorkspaceUserGroup datatype. Matches the version part provided within the `Accept` request header.

_links.description: Available <<mesh_workspaceusergroup_links,links>> on a meshWorkspaceUserGroup.

kind.description: As a common meshObject structure exists, every meshObject has a 'kind'. This is always 'meshWorkspaceUserGroup' for this endpoint.

egid.description: External Group Identifier, this is an optional field.

displayName.description: The display name of the meshWorkspaceUserGroup as it is shown in meshPanel.

tags.description: Key/Value pairs of tags set on the meshWorkspaceUserGroup. Keep in mind, that values are an array. Also see our general section about <<tags>>

spec.description: All fields in this section describe the meshWorkspaceUserGroup.

_links.description: All available <<mesh_object_links,meshObject Links>> for the authenticated user.

displayName.description: The name of the project the user was assigned to.

name.description: The identifier of the project the user was assigned to.

ownedByWorkspace.description: The identifier of the workspace which contains the project.

name.description: Name of this binding which later can be used to refer to it

apiVersion.description: Version of this object

_links.description: Currently only contains the self link and <<paging,pagination>> links.

kind.description: Type of the returned meshObject

name.description: The username of the referenced user.
The name of the referenced role for this user.

grant_type.description: The grant type, which must be 'client_credentials'.

client_secret.description: The Key Secret associated with your API key. This secret is used in conjunction with the client_id to securely authenticate your application.

client_id.description: The Key ID assigned to your API key upon creation. This ID is used to authenticate your application.

_links.description: Currently only contains the self link and <<paging,pagination>> links.

_embedded.description: Contains the actual content of the paged response.

name.description: Name of the meshObjectCollection

displayName.description: The name of the workspace the user is assigned to.

name.description: The identifier of the workspace the user is assigned to.
The meshWorkspaceUserBinding identifier as 'name' to uniquely identify the meshWorkspaceUserBinding.

metadata.description: Always contains the 'name' to uniquely identify the meshWorkspaceUserBinding.

apiVersion.description: Version of meshWorkspaceUserBinding datatype. Matches the version part provided within the `Accept` request header.

_links.description: Currently only contains the self link.

name.description: The username of the referenced user.

kind.description: As a common meshObject structure exists, every meshObject has a 'kind'. This is always 'meshWorkspaceUserBinding' for this endpoint.

name.description: The name of the referenced role for this user.

_links.description: Currently only contains the self link and <<paging,pagination>> links.

markedForDeletionOn.description: If the Building Block has been marked for deletion, the <<data_types,date>> when a user requested the deletion is provided via this field. e.g. `2020-12-22T09:37:43Z`

forcePurge.description: Set to true, if an operator explicitly requested this Building Block to be purged.

definitionVersion.description: The version number of the Building Block Definition this Building Block is based on.

markedForDeletionBy.description: If the Building Block has already been deleted, the username of the user who triggered the deletion is provided here.

createdOn.description: The Building Block has been created at this <<data_types,date>> (e.g. `2020-12-22T09:37:43Z`).

uuid.description: The UUID to uniquely identify the Building Block.

definitionUuid.description: The UUID of the Building Block Definition this Building Block is based on.

tenantIdentifier.description: The full identifier of the tenant, this Building Block is created in.

metadata.description: Always contains the 'uuid' to uniquely identify the Building Block. It also contains additional meta information like the Building Block creation date.

apiVersion.description: Version of Building Block datatype. Matches the version part provided within the `Accept` request header.

_links.description: Available <<mesh_buildingblock_links,links>> on a Building Block.

kind.description: As a common meshObject structure exists, every meshObject has a 'kind'. This is always 'meshBuildingBlock' for this endpoint.

parentBuildingBlocks.description: List of inputs, which are set on the Building Block.

buildingBlockUuid.description: The UUID of the parent Building Block.

definitionUuid.description: The UUID of the Building Block Definition of the parent Building Block.

inputs.description: List of inputs, which are set on the Building Block.

valueType.description: The data type of the value. One of STRING, INTEGER, BOOLEAN, FILE, LIST, SINGLE_SELECT, OBJECT.

value.description: The value, which is set on this input.

key.description: The key of the input as set on the related Building Block Definition.

displayName.description: The display name of the Building Block as it is shown in meshPanel.

spec.description: All fields in this section describe the Building Block.

outputs.description: List of outputs, which are set on the Building Block. Empty, just after creation.

status.description: The status of the Building Block. One of WAITING_FOR_DEPENDENT_INPUT, WAITING_FOR_OPERATOR_INPUT, PENDING, IN_PROGRESS, SUCCEEDED, FAILED.
All fields in this section describe the current status of the Building Block.

markedForDeletionOn.description: If the Building Block has been marked for deletion, the <<data_types,date>> when a user requested the deletion is provided via this field. e.g. `2020-12-22T09:37:43Z`

forcePurge.description: Set to true, if an operator explicitly requested this Building Block to be purged.

definitionVersion.description: The version number of the Building Block Definition this Building Block is based on.

markedForDeletionBy.description: If the Building Block has already been deleted, the username of the user who triggered the deletion is provided here.

createdOn.description: The Building Block has been created at this <<data_types,date>> (e.g. `2020-12-22T09:37:43Z`).

uuid.description: The UUID to uniquely identify the Building Block.

definitionUuid.description: The UUID of the Building Block Definition this Building Block is based on.

tenantIdentifier.description: The full identifier of the tenant, this Building Block is created in.

metadata.description: Always contains the 'uuid' to uniquely identify the Building Block. It also contains additional meta information like the Building Block creation date.

apiVersion.description: Version of Building Block datatype. Matches the version part provided within the `Accept` request header.

kind.description: As a common meshObject structure exists, every meshObject has a 'kind'. This is always 'meshBuildingBlockRun' for this endpoint.

uuid.description: UUID of the referenced building block.

parentBuildingBlocks.description: A list of parent building blocks UUIDs for this building block.

fullPlatformIdentifier.description: The full identifier of the platform of the building block.

inputs.description: Contains the filled in <<mesh_buildingblockrun_inputs,input objects>> for this building block run.

isSensitive.description: Flag if the variable content is sensitive and encrypted. The runner must decrypt this variable content first before it can be used.

isEnvironment.description: Flag if this variable should be provided as environment variable instead of getting handled as a 'native' variable for the chosen runner technology (for example a Terraform input).

type.description: The type of the variable. Can be one of those:

key.description: The name of the input variable.

displayName.description: Display name of the building block.

workspaceIdentifier.description: The identifier of the workspace of the building block.

projectIdentifier.description: The identifier of the project of the building block.

uuid.description: UUID of the building block definition.

implementation.description: Contains information about the used implementation e.g. Terraform specific details of the building block.

version.description: Version of the building block definition.

runNumber.description: Every run has a monotonically increasing number.

behavior.description: The behavior the runner should execute. Can be one of <<mesh_buildingblockrun_behaviors,those behaviors>>.

spec.description: All fields in this section describe the meshBuildingBlockRun.

status.description: The current execution status of this building block run.

The name of the referenced role for this group.

project-id.description: The ID of the project metadata information shall be retrieved for.

project-identifier.description: Immutable unique identifier of the project.

customer-identifier.description: Immutable unique identifier of the customer

costCenter.description: A cost center number could be a custom tag.

customNumber.description: And any further attribute can be provided as a tag.

summary.description: A short summary of the execution and its result. This is shown to the user. It should not exceed more than 300 characters. (Optional)

steps.description: Can contain updates to the steps. (Optional)

isSensitive.description: Flag if the variable content is sensitive and encrypted. The runner must decrypt this variable content first before it can be used. Information on how to do this will provided in the future.

type.description: The type of the variable. It can be one of <<mesh_buildingblockrun_iotype,those>>

value.description: The name of the input variable.

outputs.description: Contains any output this step has provided. (Optional)

userMessage.description: A message which is displayed to the user. It should not exceed more than 500 characters. (Optional)

systemMessage.description: A message which is displayed only to the operators. It should not exceed more than 500 characters. (Optional)

id.description: The ID of the step which should get updates.

status.description: The execution status of this step. Can be `PENDING`, `IN_PROGRESS`, `SUCCEEDED` or `FAILED`. (Optional)
The execution status of the building block as whole. Can be any of `PENDING`, `IN_PROGRESS`, `SUCCEEDED` or `FAILED`. (Optional)

ownedByProject.description: The identifier of the meshProject the meshTenant belongs to.

assignedTags.description: The tags assigned to this meshTenant originating from meshWorkspace, Payment Method and meshProject. Keep in mind, that values are an array. Also see our general section about <<tags>>

deletedOn.description: If the meshTenant has been submitted for deletion by a Workspace Manager, the <<data_types,date>>, the date is represented here (e.g. `2020-12-22T09:37:43Z)`. Otherwise this field is missing.

platformIdentifier.description: The identifier of the related platform instance

tenantIdentifier.description: The full identifier of this tenant, a concatenation of the workspace identifier, project identifier and platform identifier.

ownedByWorkspace.description: The identifier of the meshWorkspace the meshTenant belongs to.

metadata.description: Always contains the 'ownedByProject', 'ownedByWorkspace' and 'platformIdentifier' to identify the meshTenant.

apiVersion.description: Version of meshTenant datatype. Matches the version provided in the `Accept` request header.

_links.description: Currently only contains the self link.

kind.description: As a common meshObject structure exists, every meshObject has a 'kind'. This is always 'meshTenant' for this endpoint.

quotas.description: The set of applied Tenant Quotas. They can be set individually per tenant. By default the Landing Zone quotas are applied to new meshTenants.

landingZoneIdentifier.description: The identifier of the Landing Zone of this meshTenant. This field will be empty if the meshTenant has no Landing Zone.

localId.description: The localId (platform tenant id) assigned with this meshTenant. It will only be set if the tenant  was either imported via meshObject API with a localId or if at least one replication run finished successfully for this tenant.

spec.description: All fields in this section describe the meshTenant.

name.description: Must be of the form `$targetKind.$key` since tag definitions must be non-conflicting.

metadata.description: Always contains the 'name' to uniquely identify the meshTagDefinition.

apiVersion.description: Version of `meshTagDefinition` datatype. Matches the version part provided within the `Accept` request header.

_links.description: Currently only contains the `self` link.

kind.description: As a common meshObject structure exists, every meshObject has a `kind`. This is always `meshTagDefinition` for this endpoint.

immutable.description: Indicates whether the tag value is not editable after initially set.

replicationKey.description: The key for this tag when replicated to cloud platforms. If null, replication is disabled.

restricted.description: Indicates whether only admins can edit this tag.

displayName.description: The display name of the tag.

defaultValue.description: The default value of the tag.

number.description: a decimal number, represented a JSON number

defaultValue.description: The default value of the tag.

validationRegex.description: The regex pattern that the tag value must match.

defaultValue.description: The default value of the tag.

integer.description: an integer, represented as a JSON number

defaultValue.description: The default value of the tag.

options.description: The allowed options for the tag as a string[]

singleSelect.description: a string from a list of options, represented as a JSON string

defaultValue.description: The default value of the tag.

validationRegex.description: The regex pattern that the tag value must match.

email.description: email address, represented as JSON string

defaultValue.description: The default value of the tag.

options.description: The allowed options for the tag as a string[]

multiSelect.description: one or multiple strings from a list of option, represented as a JSON array

valueType.description: The <<mesh_tag_definition_response_fields_tag_value_type,TagValueType>> of the tag. Must define exactly one of the available types.

sortOrder.description: The sort order for this tag when displayed in the UI. meshPanel sorts tags in ascending order.

targetKind.description: The kind of meshObject this tag is defined for. At this moment only the following kinds are supported by meshStack: `WORKSPACE, PROJECT, LANDING_ZONE, PAYMENT_METHOD, BUILDING_BLOCK_DEFINITION`

description.description: The detailed description of the tag.

mandatory.description: Indicates whether the tag is mandatory.

tenantIdentifier.description: The full identifier of the tenant, this Building Block is created in.

parentBuildingBlocks.description: List of parent building blocks, which are required for the Building Block. If none given, an empty list needs to be provided.

buildingBlockUuid.description: The UUID of the parent Building Block.

definitionUuid.description: The UUID of the Building Block Definition of the parent Building Block.

inputs.description: List of inputs, which are set on the Building Block.

valueType.description: The data type of the value. One of STRING, INTEGER, BOOLEAN, FILE, LIST, SINGLE_SELECT, OBJECT.

value.description: The value, which is set on this input.

key.description: The key of the input as set on the related Building Block Definition.

displayName.description: The display name of the Building Block as it is shown in meshPanel.

spec.description: All fields in this section describe the Building Block.
